channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S. figure skater Alysa Liu said she didn't care if she medaled. She won gold
item.description: Liu is the first American woman to win an individual figure skating gold medal since Sarah Hughes in 2002.
item.content:encoded:
Liu is the first American woman to win an individual figure skating gold medal since Sarah Hughes in 2002.

(Image credit: Jamie Squire)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: The owners want to close this Colorado coal plant. The Trump administration says no
item.description: The Trump administration sent emergency orders to keep coal plants running — even when utilities want to shut them down. That's boiled over to a legal battle in Colorado.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration sent emergency orders to keep coal plants running — even when utilities want to shut them down. That's boiled over to a legal battle in Colorado.
item.dc:creator: Sam Brasch

item.title: American Jordan Stolz speedskates to a third Olympic medal -- silver this time
item.description: U.S. speedskater Jordan Stolz had a lot of hype accompanying him in these Winter Olympic Games. He's now got two gold medals, one silver, with one event to go.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. speedskater Jordan Stolz had a lot of hype accompanying him in these Winter Olympic Games. He's now got two gold medals, one silver, with one event to go.

(Image credit: Daniel Munoz)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: In a thrilling comeback win, U.S. women take home Olympic hockey gold over Canada
item.description: For much of Thursday's final, it seemed Canada would refuse to relinquish the throne of Olympic women's ice hockey to this younger American squad. But the U.S. found the grit to topple them, 2-1.
item.content:encoded:
For much of Thursday's final, it seemed Canada would refuse to relinquish the throne of Olympic women's ice hockey to this younger American squad. But the U.S. found the grit to topple them, 2-1.

(Image credit: Gregory Shamus)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: HUD rule could push families with undocumented immigrants out of their homes
item.description: A proposed rule could put nearly 80,000 people at risk of eviction, many of them U.S. citizen children. Undocumented immigrants don't get rental aid but can currently live with family members who do.
item.content:encoded:
A proposed rule could put nearly 80,000 people at risk of eviction, many of them U.S. citizen children. Undocumented immigrants don't get rental aid but can currently live with family members who do.

(Image credit: Kent Nishimura)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: 8 dead, 1 still missing after avalanche strikes backcountry skiers near Lake Tahoe
item.description: Eight people are dead after being caught in an avalanche northwest of Lake Tahoe. Dangerous conditions are making it difficult to locate one person who is still missing and presumed dead.
item.content:encoded: Eight people are dead after being caught in an avalanche northwest of Lake Tahoe. Dangerous conditions are making it difficult to locate one person who is still missing and presumed dead.
item.dc:creator: Kat Fulwider

item.title: Urban sketchers find the sublime in the city block
item.description: Sketchers say making art together in urban environments allows them to create a record of a moment and to notice a little bit more about the city they see every day.
item.content:encoded:
Sketchers say making art together in urban environments allows them to create a record of a moment and to notice a little bit more about the city they see every day.

(Image credit: Deena Prichep)
item.dc:creator: Deena Prichep

item.title: How Epstein and Maxwell used an elite Midwest arts school to prey on girls
item.description: Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell lavished money on the Interlochen Center for the Arts to gain access, documents show — even funding an on-campus lodge they stayed in. In the process, two teenagers were pulled into their orbit.
item.content:encoded: Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell lavished money on the Interlochen Center for the Arts to gain access, documents show — even funding an on-campus lodge they stayed in. In the process, two teenagers were pulled into their orbit.
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger

item.title: How genetic genealogy might help investigators in the Nancy Guthrie case
item.description: DNA science has helped solve criminal cases for decades. But increasingly, investigative genetic genealogy — which was first used for cold cases — is helping to solve active cases as well.
item.content:encoded:
DNA science has helped solve criminal cases for decades. But increasingly, investigative genetic genealogy — which was first used for cold cases — is helping to solve active cases as well.

(Image credit: Brandon Bell)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: An unsung hero stepped in to help a newly widowed mom in a moment of need
item.description: Barbara Alvarez lost her husband in 2017, just before their daughter went off to college. Her unsung hero helped her find the strength to be a single mother to her child at a key moment in their lives.
item.content:encoded: Barbara Alvarez lost her husband in 2017, just before their daughter went off to college. Her unsung hero helped her find the strength to be a single mother to her child at a key moment in their lives.
item.dc:creator: Autumn Barnes
